N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 403.1 - Selection of services

State Regulations
(a) The department shall have the following
exclusive authority with respect to services for which Federal and/or State
financial participation is available: (1)
definition of service; (2)
specification of the categories of individuals to whom service shall be
available; (3)
specification of the
methods of provision by which service may be delivered; (4)
establishment of income levels, if any, required for eligibility for service; (5)
specification of categories of
individuals to whom a fee will be charged; and
(6)
establishment of appropriate fee
schedules. (b) For
purposes of development of the district component of the comprehensive annual
social services program plan, the social services district shall select
services to meet the following requirements: (1)

At least one service must be directed
toward each of the five goals described in section
400.1
(c) of this

Title. A service may be directed toward more than one goal. (2)

At least three services must be
designated as available to recipients of supplemental security
income. (c) The Federal

Social Security Act requires that the following services be provided: (1)
family planning services for ADC
recipients (including minors who are considered sexually active) who request
such services; (2)
foster care
services for recipients of ADC/FC as described in section
358-a
of
the Social Services Law; and
(d) The New York State Social Services Law
requires social services districts to select and provide, in accordance with
stated limitations, if any, the following services: (1)

Services required to be selected and
provided without regard to the availability of State or Federal funds: (i) protective services for children, as
defined in the Child and Family Services Plan; (ii)
information and referral services to all
persons without regard to financial eligibility criteria; and
(iii)
child care services to a family
guaranteed child care assistance in accordance with section
415.2
(a)(1)
of
this Title. (2)

Services
required to be selected and provided so long as State or Federal reimbursement
is available for those purposes: (i) child
care services for a family that meets one or more of the criteria in section
415.2
(a)(2)
of
this Title; (ii)
family planning
services for persons eligible for ADC, HR and SSI; (iii)
foster care services for children to
meet the goal of protection; (iv)
health related services for persons eligible for SSI; (v) home management, homemaker, housekeeper/chore, and housing improvement services for persons eligible for
SSI; (vi)
residential placement
services for adults; (vii)
protective services for adults; and
(viii)
unmarried parents service. (3)

Services that may be selected
and provided to families if funds are available and the social services
district has listed such families as eligible in the district's Child and

Family Services Plan shall include child care services to a family that meets
one or more of the criteria in section
415.2
(a)(3)
of
this Title. (e) For each
service selected by the social services district for provision, the social
services district shall: (1)
assure
conformity with the definition of each service as prescribed by the
department; (2)
include
specification of the methods of delivery selected by the district, within the
limits prescribed by the department; (3)
identify the relationship of the service
to one or more of the five goals described in section
400.1
of this Title; and
(4)
include specification of one or more
categories of individuals to whom the service is to be provided, within the
limits prescribed by the department. Notes
